position: Readiness Experience Drive (RED) Vacation Work Programme 2023
description:

Students from 3rd and 4th year (CTA) can apply to join the office closest to them and experience what it is like to work at BDO.
 
The RED Vacation work Programme is held in person, and our commitment to you and this process is unhindered. We would expect the same of you.

As a global consulting partnership in more than 40 countries, our people make us who we are. We’re individuals who take as much joy from those we work with as the work itself. Driven to be the difference between a big idea and making it happen, we help our clients break through.
 
What You Can ExpectIndividual and inclusive to our core. As a business analyst intern, you will receive full and ready access to our firm’s best talent to help you learn, develop and make your mark.
Personal and practical. You will work alongside colleagues who will help you grow as you help our clients solve their most important issues – that’s just our style.
We’re big enough to have it covered, small enough to really care. This holds true for both you and our clients. 
You will be able to make an impact and develop your potential from day one within a professional environment and culture that actively fosters the following:Personal development. At Kearney, we encourage you to be yourself, and we give you the freedom to contribute creatively while you also learn, develop and make your mark. 
Entrepreneurial approach. The Kearney internship program is an outstanding introduction to the discipline of management consulting
Supportive environment. Training is a crucial component of your introduction to the firm. As a business analyst intern, you will learn essential concepts and methodologies that are crucial to management consulting. 
 We are looking for talented problem-solvers who are ready to integrate as full members of the client team. Interns are expected to contribute ideas, opinions, and new information.
 
The following Qualifications are preferred:A proven record of academic excellence with a bachelor's degree
Minimum of a 65% overall average.
No more than 2 subjects failed through your degree.  
Skills and Competencies:Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
Strong critical thinking and analytical capabilities
An innovative and collaborative approach to problem-solving

Proficiency in Microsoft Office

Our Winter Internship programme is a 3-week paid vacation internship programme commencing on the 26th June till 14th July 2023 for undergraduate university students. The three week programme offers in-office work experience in our Corporate Finance team in South Africa.
 
Your time here will look something like this.
The program starts with a firm wide orientation where you’ll learn about our culture, as well as the benefits and responsibilities of being a member of Citi. You will receive real time responsibilities to give you a sense of what you would be doing on a day to day basis, as a full-time Citi employee.  With fellow interns, you will work alongside leaders within Citi.
 
Responsibilities:Hands on work experience as a member of either the Corporate or the Investment Banking business unit
Get a solid understanding of the broad range of financial services and products Citi provides
Learn to build financial models and develop corporate finance solutions for our clients - we strive to create the best outcomes for our clients with financial ingenuity that simple, creative and responsible solutions
Conduct research and analyze industry trends to support our bespoke advice and superior value proposition
Participate in client development - Citi aims to be the best banking partner for our clients by delivering differentiated client experiences and maintaining a reputation of excellence
Requirements:
We want to hear from you if...We look for highly motivated candidates with a strong work ethic, a positive and proactive mindset, and a firm desire to learn and succeed
A keen interest in financial markets and current affairs is critical
We value diverse thinking and encourage students from all degree disciplines to consider our opportunities.
Advantageous: Studies in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Mathematics, Actuarial Science, Engineering and Information Technology subjects are beneficial but not essential
A strong academic record at both Matric and university level is important

We invite you to join us offices, interact with our people and learn more about why Mazars could be the perfect match for you.
 
Locations: Bloemfontein, Cape Town, Durban, Garden Route, Gauteng and Gqeberha. 
 
Duties and ResponsibilitiesThe programme is designed to be both fun and informative, and will include training sessions, talks by various members of our firm, a client visit and a fun day of teambuilding activities at the office.
You will be afforded the opportunity to engage with students from different universities, making this a great opportunity to expand on your professional network.
RequirementsMust be enrolled for a SAICA-accredited graduate or postgraduate qualification.

position: June Vacation Internship - Data Science (For Current Students) 2023
description:
ResponsibilitiesBe an out-of-the-box thinker who is passionate about brainstorming innovative ways to use our unique data to answer business problems
Extract and understand data to form an opinion on how to best help our clients and derive relevant insights
Working closely with teams across all regions in CEMEA to develop scalable and innovative big data and machine learning solutions
Applying industry leading data science techniques to generate impactful insights for clients and to address real business problems
Developing visualizations to conduct diagnostics and to connect ideas into well-grounded insights for scalable reporting using tools such as Tableau and PowerBI
Performing data analysis on large and complex dataset using tools such as Python/SQL/Spark to provide actionable recommendations 
Requirements:Degree in a quantitative field such as:
Computer Science,
Mathematics,
Statistics
Econometrics
Students pursuing a Bachelor’s (Honors) or Masters Degree with a graduation date by end of 2023 or 2024
Be available to pursue the internship June to September 2023 (Full-time)
Excellent communication, story-telling and presentation skills
Skills and Competencies:Extracting and aggregating data from large data sets using SQL/Hive or Spark
Analyzing large data sets using programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, SAS and/or Spark and using development environments such as Jupyter Notebooks
Generating and visualizing data-based insights in software such as Tableau
Communicating data-driven insights and conveying actionable recommendations
Managing and organizing work in Office software such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint and/or Teams
Building predictive and descriptive statistical models using machine learning tool kit, Jupyter notebooks, Python, and/or SAS
Data mining and statistical modeling (e.g., regression modeling, clustering techniques, decision trees, etc.)
Superior analytical and financial analysis skills
Strong collaboration skills with a diverse peer group required

position: EMEA Banking Winter Vacation Internship Programme 2023
description:
Whether you’ve got prior financial industry experience or not, this 3-week internship provides an opportunity to work for one of the world’s largest financial services organisations.  If your internship is successful, you could be considered for one of Citi’s full-time graduate or analyst programmes. 
 
These uniquely designed full-time programmes place university graduates in specific functional teams within the bank. Our full-time programmes start with extensive classroom training and also the opportunity to complete globally recognised qualifications.
 
Your time here will look something like this:                                                                                                                Hands on work experience as a member of either the Corporate or the Investment Banking business unit
Get a solid understanding of the broad range of financial services and products Citi provides
Learn to build financial models and develop corporate finance solutions for our clients - we strive to create the best outcomes for our clients with financial ingenuity that simple, creative and responsible solutions
Conduct research and analyze industry trends to support our bespoke advice and superior value proposition
Participate in client development - Citi aims to be the best banking partner for our clients by delivering differentiated client experiences and maintaining a reputation of excellence and integrity     
We want to hear from you if...We look for highly motivated candidates with a strong work ethic, a positive and proactive mindset, and a firm desire to learn and succeed
A keen interest in financial markets and current affairs is critical
We value diverse thinking and encourage students from all degree disciplines to consider our opportunities.
A strong academic record at both Matric and university level is important
Studies in: Finance, Accounting, Economics, Mathematics, Actuarial Science, Engineering and Information Technology subjects are beneficial but not essential 
Skills and Competencies:Desire to develop a deep understanding of the financial markets and banking industry
Analytical and quantitative skills
Strong communication, planning and organizational skills
Knowledge of the global or domestic business landscape
A strong desire to learn and success in team environments
Commitment to personal growth and career development

Purpose of the role: Our Client Service Centre is integral to our service offering for investors and our network of independent financial advisers. Our Investment Service Consultants are university graduates equipped with products, business and industry knowledge to support our investors and independent financial advisers effectively.
 
Should you be selected to experience your internship in Retail Client Services, you will work alongside smart individuals on specialized projects designed to further enhance our service delivery to clients.
 
Responsibilities:
The successful interns will be placed in suitable roles,  either Investment Service Consultant or Retail Operations for a 2 week internship to solve different challenges in each, with an opportunity to get exposure to the business, be mentored by others and present their results to senior management at Allan Gray.
 
Requirements:This internship is only open to final year students currently completing an under or post graduate Commerce or Business Science degree with majors in: Finance, Economics, Investments, Engineering, Mathematics and Statistics.
Consistently strong academic performance
Must be eligible to work in South Africa
Skills and Competencies:Strong client focus and interest in investments
An enquiring mind and problem-solving abilities
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work in a team of highly skilled individuals while delivering on your own personalised goals
Highly adaptable and resilient

Our Winter Analyst programme is designed to offer you a broad and exciting experience of work within Investment Banking. During your internship, you will be gaining exposure to a variety of industry, country or product coverage teams.
 
Your training and development are our top priorities with structured support offered on the job, networking opportunities, educational speaker events and mentorship throughout.
 
Responsibilities:
As an Intern, your key tasks and responsibilities may include but are not limited to:Work on projects alongside bankers in specific industry, product and country coverage groups providing you with a unique learning opportunity
Help the team deliver solutions to clients leveraging full spectrum of the Bank's capabilities
Actively contribute to the preparation of client presentations and underlying financial analysis
Build relationships, knowledge and experience that will open doors to a wide range of future career opportunities
Through our unique pooling system, you will have the opportunity to work across multiple areas, giving you a broad understanding of the investment banking profession and offer you the chance to explore your best fit for a full-time placement
Requirements:Candidates are required to be in their penultimate year of study pursuing a degree from an accredited college or university
Strong A-level grades and on-track for a minimum 2:1 degree classification (or equivalent)
Fluency in English is essential for all our roles 
NB. For some roles within Emerging Markets (including sub-Sahara Africa, Russia and China), a knowledge of those regions is required so that support in the marketing of products, advising and coordinating the marketing effort to existing and potential investor base in the emerging markets region can be provided.
 
Skills and Competencies:You'll need to demonstrate drive, innovation and a genuine interest in the financial markets
Teamwork, leadership and problem-solving skills,
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment,
Displaying analytical and problem-solving skills
Influencing decisions and outcomes through effective communication and interpersonal skills
Demonstrating integrity and ethics by earning other's trust and respect through consistent honesty and professionalism in all interactions
